ProjectDescr.Title: Genome sequencing data files of a butyrate-producing gut bacterium Agathobaculum butyriciproducens SR79T
ProjectDescr.Description: Butyrate, one of the short-chain fatty acids produced by beneficial gut bacteria, is known to regulate insulin resistance and immune function. Agathobaculum butyriciproducens SR79T, a butyrate-producing anaerobic bacterium of a new genus, was isolated and identified from the feces of a healthy woman by researchers at the Korea Research Institute of Bioscience and Biotechnology. This BioProject aims to provide raw sequencing data files from PacBio and Illumina platforms for the genome sequencing of SR79T, the type strain of Agathobaculum butyriciproducens.

Organization.Name: Korea Research Institute of Bioscience and Biotechnology
